block.p: Christine Helen Grahl, a daughter of Kathleen and Larry Grahl of Mattaponi, Va., was married last evening to Andrew Kober Gottesman, the son of Barbara Gottesman of West Orange, N.J., and Harold Gottesman of Old Lyme, Conn. Rabbi Michael Joseph officiated at Old St. John's, a chapel in King William, Va.

Mrs. Gottesman, 32, is an associate in the New York office of Sidley & Austin, the Chicago law firm. She graduated from the College of William and Mary and received a law degree cum laude from Harvard University. Her father, a retired Foreign Service officer, was the United States consul general in Karachi, Pakistan, until 1988, and later the acting deputy assistant secretary of state for intelligence and coordination in Washington.

Christine Helen Grahl, a daughter of Kathleen and Larry Grahl of Mattaponi, Va., was married last evening to Andrew Kober Gottesman, the son of Barbara Gottesman of West Orange, N.J., and Harold Gottesman of Old Lyme, Conn. Rabbi Michael Joseph officiated at Old St. John's, a chapel in King William, Va.

Mrs. Gottesman, 32, is an associate in the New York office of Sidley & Austin, the Chicago law firm. She graduated from the College of William and Mary and received a law degree cum laude from Harvard University. Her father, a retired Foreign Service officer, was the United States consul general in Karachi, Pakistan, until 1988, and later the acting deputy assistant secretary of state for intelligence and coordination in Washington.
Mr. Gottesman, 30, was until August an assistant city editor at The Chicago Tribune. He graduated from the University of Michigan and received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Chicago.

Next month, the bridegroom is to become the general manager at Edison Investment Advisors, a family fund in Livingston, N.J. His father is the fund's chairman and was also a founder of the Edison Parking Corporation, a parking and storage company that was in Newark.
